item.title: The Grand Theft Auto Franchise is Approaching an Incredible Milestone
item.description:
The famed Grand Theft Auto franchise is just 45 million units away from achieving half a billion total units sold across all entries in the series. Currently, gamers are eagerly anticipating the long-awaited release of the sixth mainline Grand Theft Auto game, which, after being delayed out of 2025, is now scheduled for release on May 26, 2026. Set in a modern-day Vice City, Grand Theft Auto 6 will introduce a pair of "Bonnie and Clyde"-style protagonists in Jason and Lucia.

It's been well over a decade since the franchise's most recent mainline entry, Grand Theft Auto 5, in 2013. Its live service counterpart, GTA Online, has largely become the series' main focus since then, while developer Rockstar Games went on to release Red Dead Redemption 2 in 2018. GTA 5 has become one of the best-selling games of the past decade, having earned around $10 billion since release, and famously crossing the $1 billion mark faster than any entertainment product in history.

GTA is 45 Million Units Away from Half a Billion

In a new earnings call by video game publisher Take-Two Interactive, the lifetime unit sales of the entire Grand Theft Auto franchise were revealed. Across its five mainline titles and all its spin-offs, the Grand Theft Auto franchise has sold a whopping 455 million units, which means it's just 45 million units short of half a billion. Impressively, Grand Theft Auto 5 accounts for nearly half of these total units, having sold 215 million copies since 2013.

With GTA 6 coming out in less than a year, it's entirely plausible that it could boost the franchise past the 500 million mark by the end of 2026. The game is being hailed as perhaps the most highly anticipated game release of all time, and the numbers on both its YouTube trailers support it. As for the older titles in the GTA franchise, the report doesn't parse out exactly how many units each release contributed to GTA' s current 455 units, but it can be assumed that, aside from GTA 5 , Grand Theft Auto 4 , Vice City , and San Andreas likely put up major numbers for the franchise. If Grand Theft Auto continues to be this wildly popular and successful, there's no question it'll reach one billion units at some point many decades from now; it'll just be a matter of when.

With Grand Theft Auto 6 on its way next year, fans will most likely see another trailer or two before its big release. One of these is likely to be a voiced-over gameplay trailer like recent GTA and Red Dead Redemption games have had in the past. Perhaps GTA 6 will have a new trailer drop before the end of 2025, as its latest one came in May. It'll be fascinating to see how quickly GTA 6 propels the franchise past the 500 million units mark after the game releases next year.

item.title: Recently Added Xbox Game Pass Co-Op Game is Already a Big Hit
item.description:
Grounded 2 has broken into the top 10 list of Xbox's most played games, marking a triumph for the development teams at Obsidian Entertainment and Eidos Montreal. Tough competition from more major games ranking above Grounded 2 shows that it's been doing extremely well with players since launching in early access.

A follow-up to Obsidian's backyard survival action-adventure game Grounded , which first entered early access in 2020, Grounded 2 had its own early access launch on July 29 for Xbox Series X/S and PC. With Xbox Game Studios handling publishing duties, it was also one of several day-one games added to Xbox Game Pass in July, which is likely to have helped out its player numbers quite a bit.

Xbox's Most-Played Games List (August 8, 2025)

  1. Fortnite
  2. Roblox
  3. Call of Duty
  4. Minecraft
  5. Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege X
  6. Grand Theft Auto 5 (Xbox One)
  7. Rocket League
  8. NBA 2K25 (Xbox Series X|S)
  9. EA Sports College Football 26
  10. Grounded 2

Now, 10 days after the early access launch, Grounded 2 appears in 10th place on Xbox's official most-played games list, and it has reached #9 according to Klobrille on Bluesky. That's still not the top of the hill, but it's still quite an impressive feat, considering the games sitting in the top nine slots. Well-established free-to-play Xbox games Fortnite and Roblox sit in the number one and two spots, respectively, with Rocket League similarly claiming seventh. Additionally, fellow Game Pass game Minecraft , also a staple of the list, currently sits in fourth, while popular sports games NBA 2K25 and EA Sports College Football 26 take up the spots just in front of Grounded 2 .

Data from Steam shows that Grounded 2 on PC is also being relatively well-received, though not near the level of its performance on Xbox. With more than 8,700 user reviews left so far, the game is sitting in the platform's "Mostly Positive" category, with a 78 percent approval rating from players. It's had an all-time peak of nearly 49,000 players simultaneously on Steam, and while numbers have dropped off since the early access launch, its highest concurrent player count over the last 24 hours still comes near to half of that peak.

While the Honey, I Shrunk the Kids -like adventure has already been putting up some surprising numbers in its early days, there's still a lot of development left to go into the game before its full release. That journey took a little over two years for the original Grounded , and the roadmap for Grounded 2 shows big updates planned for the fall, winter, next summer, and beyond, including new creatures, armor, weapons, tools, and special features like ziplines and passive mutations.

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for August 8
item.description:
Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. The annual Solstice Event has arrived for Destiny 2 , bringing a touch of summer to the online game with beach-themed armor, weapon skins, and a focus on the solar subclass. Naturally, players have new weapons to chase as well, including the returning Fortunate Star Void Bow.

Alongside Solstice, BUngie continues to crank away on new Destiny 2 updates, fixing the remaining issues, bugs, and other problem areas that are impacting the experience. Earlier this week, the latest Destiny 2 update addressed a frustrating issue with the Crucible, essentially preventing players from sprinting. Bungie was able to put a fix in place, though it warned that the issue could still rear its head under certain circumstances until a permanent update can be applied.

With the weekend finally here, the weekend merchant Xur is back with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of August 8, 2025.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley is to the right, where Xur is standing.

Destiny 2 Class Armor

Starting with the Edge of Fate expansion, Xur's role in the Tower has expanded a bit. While Xur no longer carries legendary armor, the merchant has increased his exotic offering by selling two pieces of gear for each class each week. Xur's new Destiny 2 inventory can still be found at the Tower Bazaar.

Xur's Exotic Armor

Crown of Tempests - Warlock helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Conduction Tines - While you have an Arc ability equipped, Arc ability or Jolt final blows increase the recharge rate of your abilities and extend the duration of Stormtrance.

Stat Values (61 Total):

  • Health +12
  • Melee +0
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +0
  • Class +29
  • Weapons +20

Necrotic Grip - Warlock gauntlets

Exotic Perk :

  • Grasp of the Devourer - Damaging a target with melee poisons them, dealing increasing damage over time. Defeating a poisoned target spreads the condition. Provides a moderate benefit to the airborne effectiveness stat of all Weapons of Sorrow.

Stat Values (60 Total):

  • Health +19
  • Melee +30
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +0
  • Class +11
  • Weapons +0

Lucky Pants - Hunter leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Illegally Modded Holster - Improves sprint, slide, and airborne effectiveness while a Hand Cannon is equipped. For a short time after being drawn, Hand Cannons ready faster, are more accurate, and each hit against a combatant increases Hand Cannon damage.

Stat Values (59 Total):

  • Health +30
  • Melee +0
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +0
  • Class +18
  • Weapons +11

Athrys's Embrace - Hunter gauntlets

Exotic Perk :

  • Skittering Stinger - Weighted Knife gains a second bounce. Rapid precision hits with your weapons grant Weighted Knife a significant damage bonus, bonus melee, and the ability to stun unshielded combatants for a short time. Empowered Weighted Knife is strong against Unstoppable Champions.

Stat Values (61 Total):

  • Health +0
  • Melee +0
  • Grenade +30
  • Super +20
  • Class +0
  • Weapons +11

Armamentarium - Titan chest armor

Exotic Perk :

  • And Another Thing - Gain an additional grenade charge. Grenade final blows spawn an Orb of Power.

Stat Values (60 total):

  • Health +0
  • Melee +13
  • Grenade +0
  • Super +0
  • Class +29
  • Weapons +18

Loreley Splendor Helm - Titan helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Cauterizing Flame - While you have a Solar Super equipped, casting your Barricade or becoming critically wounded with full class ability energy creates a Sunspot at your location.

Stat Values (62 Total):

  • Health +0
  • Melee +20
  • Grenade +13
  • Super +29
  • Class +0
  • Weapons +0

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Bad Juju Catalyst
  • Lord of Wolves Catalyst
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Shard
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Raid Banner (7 for 11 Strange Coins)
  • Favor of the Nine
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Exotic Ciphers

  • Xenology - Complete activities in the Portal with a performance grade B or higher. Additional progress is awarded for better performance grades, activities with a longer average duration, and for succeeding with clanmates.

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Here is what Xur has this weekend for exotic weapons:

Hawkmoon - Hand Cannon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Smallbore
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Quickdraw
  • Combat Grip

The Jade Rabbit - Scout Rifle

  • The Fate of All Fools - Chain precision shots to gain bonus damage on your next body shot and return ammo to the mag.
  • Zen Moment - Causing damage with this weapon reduces recoil and flinch over time.
  • Polygonal Rifling
  • High-Caliber Rounds

Fighting Lion - Grenade Launcher

  • Delayed Gratification - Grenade projectiles will bounce off surfaces. Fire and then release to detonate.
  • Thin The Herd - Direct hits do increased damage to combatant shields and cause a volatile detonation. Dealing damage increases reload speed. Rapid final blows against grenade-damaged combatants refill the magazine.
  • Countermass
  • Implosion Rounds
  • Short-Action Stock

D.A.R.C.I. - Sniper Rifle

  • Personal Assistant - Aim at a target to view their health and other critical information in the scope. Jolts targets when dealing damage. Strong against Overload Champions.
  • Target Acquired - When Personal Assistant is active, this weapon has better target acquisition and deals significantly more precision damage.
  • Extended Barrel
  • Extended Mag
  • Short-Action Stock

Xur's Destiny 2 Legendary Weapons

Xur's Set of Legendary Weapons. All weapons cost 17 Strange Coins.

  • Duty Bound (Adept Kinetic Auto Rifle)
  • Whispering Slab (Kinetic Combat Bow)
  • Refusal of the Call (Kinetic Glaive)
  • Anamnesis (Energy Combat Bow)
  • Deadpan Delivery (Energy Shotgun)
  • Keen Thistle (Energy Sniper Rifle)
  • Scintillation (Adept Heavy Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Faith-Keeper (Heavy Rocket Launcher)
  • Reed's Regret (Heavy Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram (7 Strange Coins)

Play Destiny 2: The Edge of Fate. Guardians will track a mysterious signal to a location at the edge of the solar system, where they will uncover a truth that redefines their future.

The Future Is Now - A new adventure and the start of a new saga in Destiny 2. World tiers allow Guardians to select the level of difficulty that is right for them and reap the rewards that come with victory. Higher tiers offer more challenge, additional narrative threads, new secrets to uncover, and more powerful gear to collect.

Access Kepler’s Secrets - Hidden deep within the Reef, a new destination awaits: the mysterious planetoid of Kepler. Explore a lost human settlement and forgotten Fallen houses, and encounter new characters, all affected by a mysterious Anomaly that has twisted the destination into something menacing.

Destination Abilities - Push the limit of your Guardian’s capabilities and unlock the mysteries of Kepler with new destination abilities, powered by the mysterious Anomaly.

New Foes - Two new enemy combatants have entered the fray. Cut down swarming masses of Vex drones known as Kobolds, and face diabolical hovering Fallen Corsairs, each intent on standing in the way of your success.

item.title: 2026 Could Be a Bloodbath for PS4 Live Service Games
item.description:
New reports indicate that multiple live service game developers could stop supporting the PlayStation 4 in 2026. While this change would not be entirely surprising, considering that the PS5 was released five years ago, this will certainly feel like a bloodbath to PS4 owners if it does happen.

The PlayStation 4 was released in 2013, and it sold over 117 million units as of 2022, becoming the second best-selling Sony console, behind only the PS2. However, as the years since the PS5’s release passed, the newer console sold over 80.2 million units, reaching a wide audience. Earlier this year, it was revealed that the PS5 currently has more active players than the PS4.

Multiple Developers Could Stop Supporting PS4 in 2026

Now, a new report from GamesIndustry.biz has painted a possible grim future for the once-popular PS4. While the report is mostly focused on PlayStation’s place in the game industry, it does signal that many "operators of major online and live service titles" are "eyeing up the timeline for dropping PS4 support.” The report comes on the heels of HoyoVerse’s decision to end support for Genshin Impact on PS4. At the time, HoyoVerse explained that technical concerns such as the slow hard drive of the PS4 made it difficult to run Genshin Impact as the game got larger, and install bases on new consoles are getting larger than ever.

Despite these indications, it’s still too early to tell for sure how big the impact will be, as the reports do not name any companies that will stop offering live service games on the PS4. Popular live service titles such as Fortnite and Call of Duty are still available on PS4 at the time of this report, for example.

However, the signs of major companies finally abandoning the PS4 are already visible. Grand Theft Auto 6 will only be available on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S, which will lock many gamers out of its rumored online mode. It’s not known how long the current GTA Online will be maintained, too, as keeping both services active could cannibalize the user base of the new game.

Another noteworthy game to skip on the PS4 is the upcoming Battlefield 6 . Battlefield 6 promises to be one of the biggest shooters of 2025, and it’s significant that EA decided to skip last-gen consoles for its release. In any case, time will tell if 2026 will really mark the year that major live service games move away from the PS4.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Campfire Goodies Rewards and Milestones
item.description:
The Sunset Treasures event has been a total favorite among Monopoly GO players. With rewards like the Wild Sticker and the Sandcastle Shield, it has been keeping everyone busy. If you have also been digging, there's some good news for you. A new banner event called Campfire Goodies is here to help you out.

Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO began on August 8 and will run for two days and three hours, wrapping up on August 10 alongside the Sunset Treasures minigame. It’s the perfect chance to collect Pickaxe Tokens so you can push further in Sunset Treasures and maybe even earn the Wild Sticker before time runs out. In addition to that, there are many other rewards waiting for you as you reach milestones. Scroll down to check out all the milestones and rewards for the Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO event.

Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO Rewards and Milestones

Let's take a look at all the rewards available in Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO :

Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO Rewards Summary

The Campfire Goodies event consists of 62 milestones . Every milestone offers a reward, so there are 62 rewards in total. As you progress, the rewards keep getting better. Here's a quick list of the best rewards available in the Campfire Goodies event:

  • Grand Reward of 5,500 Dice Rolls
  • A Three-Star Sticker Pack at the 26th Milestone
  • A 15-Minute Color Wheel Boost at the 44th Milestone
  • A 40-Minute Mega Heist at the 50th Milestone
  • A 15-Minute Builder's Bash at the 18th Milestone
  • A 15-Minute Cash Boost at the 57th Milestone
  • 17,465 Dice Rolls in Total
  • 199 Pickaxe Tokens for Sunset Treasures
  • Four Sticker Packs in Total

As you can see, the Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO event has all sorts of rewards, but with the Sunset Treasures minigame still live, the real star here is definitely the Pickaxe Tokens. If players manage to clear all 62 milestones, they will collect around 200 Pickaxe Tokens .

This will give you a solid chance to push through more levels in Sunset Treasures and aim for the top prize. You’re going to need a lot of tokens to make it happen, so this event is a great way to earn them. And if you end up with more tokens than you can actually spend, they won’t go to waste. Once the event wraps up, the game will automatically convert each unused token into three dice rolls .

Apart from the tokens, Campfire Goodies also hands out over 17,000 dice rolls . The next Partners Event is just a few days away, and we all know how hard it can be to complete those partnerships. Having a big stash of dice ready can make a huge difference if you want to earn the best rewards. On top of that, there are four sticker packs sprinkled throughout the milestones. The one most players will have their eyes on is the pink sticker pack at milestone 26.

Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO will only run for two days, so start rolling now and grab all the sweet rewards on offer.

How to Get Points in Campfire Goodies Monopoly GO

Campfire Goodies works a bit differently from your usual Monopoly GO solo events. Instead of going for specific tiles, players will have to aim for pickups that are scattered randomly around the board. When you land on one, it will disappear and appear somewhere else.

Every pickup you land on gives you two points , but if you increase your multiplier, you can earn way more in one turn. For example, if you set it to 50x, that’s 100 points in a single landing. Sometimes you will get lucky and have pickups spawn right next to each other, which is the perfect time to take advantage of a high multiplier. However, keep in mind that using a higher multiplier will also eat through your dice a lot faster, so if you are just starting out, pace yourself and don’t spend your dice too quickly.
